text: INT. EVE’S APARTMENT - NIGHT At the center of an overhead image which is SLOWLY TURNIN CLOCKWISE, a woman [EVE] is lying on a bed. She is on her back, fully clothed, eyes closed, her hands symmetrically crossed over her chest. She appears to be i her late 30’s or early 40’s but, like ADAM, there is something ageless about her. She wears vintage white deni jacket and matching slim jeans, and boots. Her hair is pa blonde, her skin a luminous white, and lips colored deep with lipstick. The image, now wider, STOPS TURNING leaving her verticall composed on her island-like bed. The apartment is a singl large open room with bedroom, kitchenette, dining area, a foyer.  2. EVE is lying on a darkly iridescent Moroccan fabric. She remains completely motionless. Even her breathing is not perceptible. Berber carpets cover the floors around her. A gentle breeze moves darkly patterned curtains as faint sounds of the night drift in from the balcony: footsteps, voices speaking French and Arabic, a loud Arabic pop song from the radio of a moving car...eventually a distant cal prayer is audible. EVE’s eyes spring open. They are electric blue and completely alert, retaining no trace of sleep. She abrupt sits upright and looks at the vintage Chanel watch on her wrist, her lively eyes then glancing towards the windows.

(with an English accent) Oh, shit. She gracefully springs to her feet and moves toward the d Effortlessly, she sweeps a black and white head-scarf, an white western style Stetson hat, and a vintage shoulder-b from the surface of an elaborately inlaid table on her wa out the door.

INT. ADAM’S LIVINGROOM - NIGHT The 45rpm record continues skipping on the turntable. ADA still on the sofa, head rolled back, pale and thin, shows sign of life. His breathing is not perceptible. The doorbell rings. ADAM’s eyes open. They are suddenly remarkably alert, but somehow world-weary. Without lifting his head he listens the skipping record. The doorbell rings again.

(with an English accent) Fuckin’ hell... He sits up, then stands, in one continuous, weary motion. makes his way across the room, following a narrow path through the instruments and equipment. Pulling a curtain back slightly, ADAM looks out his window. Below ADAM sees a young man [IAN] step back from the fron door and look up at the window. The young man, dressed imitatively of ADAM, carries a guitar case in one hand an waves up at ADAM with the other.  3. ADAM closes the curtain and moves away from the window.
ADAM is reascending the stairs after letting IAN in, who follows behind him. ADAM now carries the worn guitar case
(with American accent) Yeah, man, I finally found it for you. Hey, should I take my boots off? They’re all wet.
I wouldn’t bother.

INT. ADAM’S LIVINGROOM - NIGHT The two men enter the livingroom and make their way to th rectangular coffee table in front of the sofa. ADAM clear the table and places the case on its surface. He flips th latches and opens it. Inside is an unusual electric guitar, weathered black wit aged-white pick-guard: a Supro from the 1950s. ADAM lifts from its case. He looks down the guitar’s neck, then runs his fingers up its fretboard.
(quietly) Very nice, Ian. Cheers.
(proudly) Yeah, and all the electronics and everything are original, of course. I made sure they all work.

(still examining the guitar) Just what the doctor ordered, as they say. There is a morose tone detectable in ADAM’s voice and movements, as he places the guitar upright on the sofa. ADAM (cont'd) I shall call him William Lawes.
It’s male?  The two stand, looking down at the guitar.
This one is, yeah.
And who’s William Lawes?
(distracted) Oh, uh, just some old English guy. Wrote some great funeral music. (then even more distant) Then, during the English Civil War, he was casually shot by a Parliamentarian...

Oh. (then after a longer pause) Adam, are you, uh, you ok? ADAM, miles away, sinks into the sofa while IAN moves equipment off a nearby brocade-covered chair. IAN (cont'd) (excitedly) You know, your new stuff is really echoing through the underground. It’s all over the place! (then sitting down) I mean, I know you never want to do anything live, I understand, but man I’m gettin’ more and more calls with offers all the time! One label offered a really huge advance. And I got several calls about scoring films, also offering a lot of money, man.
Let’s not talk about money, shall we. Don’t I pay you enough?
No, yeah! You pay me really well! You bought my car, and everything.

Good. Listen Ian, I don’t give a shit about money. You know that. (pause) I’m like Gomez Adams. Independently wealthy... IAN glances at the shabby walls and clutter of dusty equipment surrounding them.
(sincerely) Well, maybe being so reclusive is only going to make everybody more interested in your music.
(after a pause) Yeah. What a drag. Then I’1l just have to...disappear...again...
(curiously) Again? But again ADAM has drifted off, his brooding eyes fixed o something a thousand miles away. IAN (cont'd) Uh, what were you saying?
(only partially returning to the present) Listen, Ian, there is something you can do for me.
Sure. Anything. What is it?
(looking off) I need a bullet. A very special bullet.
Seriously?
A .32 caliber bullet, but made of wood.
A wooden bullet? Really?

Yes, and made from the hardest and most dense wood possible. I would suggest ironwood, Lignum Vitae, or possibly snakewood, Piratineia Guianensis. Maybe African blackwood, Dalbergia Melanoxylon. Here. I’ve written them down. Think you can find someone who can make it for me? He hands IAN a small scrap of paper. IAN looks at it.
Well, uh. Yeah, I think I know someone who could, uh... (then looking up at ADAM) What the hell for, though?
(looking over at him) It’s for a rather secret project. An “art” project. ADAM lazily pulls a stack of folded bills from somewhere hands them to IAN.
Oh! Well, let me think. And, uh, does the shell casing have to be made of wood too? I mean, don’t they have to be made of brass or something?
Yeah, they do. The shell casing should be brass, but the bullet has to be pure wood. The heaviest, most dense wood.
Ok. A wooden bullet. (then, putting the cash in his coat pocket) Just one?
Just the one, yeah.
Ok, I’ll get right on it. (pause) Anything else weird that you need?
Can you jump start my car for me? ADAM stands up.
Really? Uh, sure. (then, also standing up) You going somewhere?
(distantly) Just for a drive. ADAM moves toward the door, putting on a leather jacket i the process and picking up a worn leather doctor’s bag.
(now following) Uh, shouldn’t we talk about some more music stuff?
(going out the door) Let’s not, shall we?
(following him out) Well, do you want some company?

EXT. ADAM’S HOUSE - NIGHT On the slushy street in front of ADAM’s house, IAN stands near the open hood of ADAM’s dirty white Jaguar, a 1989 X coupe. Jumper cables connect its battery to the one in IA late-model BMW 3 Series. ADAM sits behind the wheel of his Jag, turns the ignition its engine fires up.
Cheers Ian! Let me know about that bullet, yeah? Just between us.

(disconnecting cables) Of course. As always. IAN watches the ghostly white Jag pull away, a hint of fo rising off the surrounding slush and snow. The car disappears into a background of abandoned industrial buildings.

ADAM’s face is concealed by a white surgical mask, his ha pulled up under a pale blue surgeon’s cap. Only his inten eyes are recognizable. He walks deliberately through the dingy florescence of a hospital corridor. Dressed in a white lab coat over pale green scrubs, ADAM carries the outdated leather doctor’s bag in one hand, a stethoscope hanging around his neck. His eyes unobtrusively survey the details around him: Two oblivious male nurses talk in Spanish adjacent to a v elderly man on a gurney who is coughing violently. Two more gurneys pass silently, their occupants completel covered by sheets, including their heads. An older, hagga female nurse pushes the second of these. Her tired eyes, though seeking sympathy, glance at ADAM as he passes. He pauses in front of an open door to a small room. Insid nurse applies pressure to a wad of white gauze covering a wound on the leg of a reclining female patient. Blood is soaking into the gauze. ADAM’s eyes fix on the seeping blood, following several drops that fall onto the floor. eyes have widened, triggered by a primal urge that he visibly, though subtly, fights to suppress. Noticing him nurse, then patient, both look over in his direction. ADA collects himself and continues moving down the corridor. Outside another doorway, he passes a male patient in hosp gown sitting catatonically in a wheelchair, an unlit cigarette in his half-open mouth. A tube runs from his ar to an I.V. on a stand attached to the wheelchair. The I.V  9. bag appears to contain blood. Again ADAM’s eyes flash, bu he keeps walking. At the end of this corridor ADAM passes through two unmar white swinging doors. Inside this area only a few doctors are visible, drinking coffee and talking somberly. ADAM passes through another set of unmarked swinging door Here, surrounded by several electronic machines, two male doctors talk with an attractive female in a white lab coa One nods to ADAM as he passes. ADAM nods back, passing another man in white lab coat, asleep in a nearby chair. At the end of a short white hallway ADAM pauses, briefly looking back, before opening a single white door, this on marked: RESTRICTED.

ADAM, almost silently, enters a room lined with glass-cov shelves, the shelves lined with medications and restricte supplies. A single technician, a PHARMACIST, in white lab coat, sit a metal table, his back turned to ADAM. On the table’s surface, his white gloved hands utilize a flat knife-like instrument, as he deftly separates a large pile of loose capsules by color. Just beyond this table, behind more glass shelves is anot smaller room. On its glass door a sign reads: ATTENTION TEMPERATURE CONTROL. Suspended bags of plasma and blood a visible inside. Adam silently steps closer watching over the man’s should The PHARMACIST pauses for a moment, shifting to write a number on a clipboard. Then, detecting ADAM’s presence, h suddenly turns toward him.

Oh, Jesus! You half-scared the shit out of me. The jittery PHARMACIST swivels in his chair. He appears t be a little younger than ADAM, with dark-framed glasses a post-collegiate haircut. Unlike ADAM, he wears a white sh and tie under his lab coat. PHARMACIST (cont'd) I’ve sort of been expecting you recently, for some reason, Doctor uh...Doctor Who. ADAM takes a thick stack of folded bills from a pocket an hands them to the PHARMACIST.  10. After glancing over ADAM’s shoulder toward the door, the PHARMACIST counts the bills at lightning speed (almost li magic trick) before nervously pocketing them. PHARMACIST (cont'd) You know, this, uh, this set-up is a bit unnerving for me. Wouldn’t you consider meeting somewhere outside the hospital sometime? Instead of just appearing unexpectedly like a...phantom?
That would require pre-arrangement.
I know, but, it would be much safer for me.

I like to come to the source. Also the mutual jeopardy makes me feel safer. Excuse me, but I don’t have any spare time. ADAM deliberately places his doctor’s bag on the metal ta his own white-gloved hands holding it open. Nervously the PHARMACIST stands up.
Right, let me get you what you need, uh, Doctor. (pause) By the way, that stethoscope you have there is practically an antique. (then turning away) From the 1970s, or maybe even the ‘60s...
(cautiously watching the PHARMACIST’s back as he opens the door to the inner room) Is it? (pause) Well, still serves its purpose.

(in Arabic to the BARMAN) You sure he wasn’t here earlier? The BARMAN shakes his head, then gestures with both hands indicating that he has no answer. Just then, all heads tu to the door. Moments later a man enters [MARLOWE]. He is an older man, but striking; his eyes assured, but cautious. He is thin and wears a trimmed beard and an odd mixture of clothing representing both the late Sixteenth late Twentieth centuries. Dangling from one pale hand are two white, unmarked plastic bags, like those from a pharm MARLOWE nods to the men at the bar, who respectfully retu the gesture as though greeting the owner or boss. MARLOWE approaches EVE, who smiles. She rises from the small tabl EVE (cont'd) Hello, darling. Embracing him, she kisses his cheek, then both sit down. EVE (cont'd) There’s only an hour ‘til sunrise.
I’m aware of that, my dear. He places one of the white bags on the floor next to EVE. She immediately leans over and carefully places it inside vintage shoulder bag.
(again smiling) Is it the really good stuff?
Yes, Eve. It is.
(whispering) From the French doctor?
Precisely.  12.
(now louder) I’m so happy to see you Christopher Marlowe! One of the men at the bar briefly glances over at them.
(quietly but very sternly) I’ve told you a thousand times to never, ever, call me that ina public place.
(playfully drawn to his crankiness) Yes, I know, darling. But it’s so difficult to continue hiding such a delicious secret.
(glancing over his shoulder) Eve, please...
(again whispering, eyes twinkling) The most outrageous scandal in literary history!

(defensively) Eve, stop. I beg you. (pause) Anyway, no one would believe me...not in...four hundred years. He begins to drift away. Noticing, EVE reaches over and places her hand on MARLOWE’s sleeve. After a brief pause, she pulls her hand back.

Kit, have you really been wearing this frock since 1590? He looks away, a twinge of guilt briefly crossing his fac EVE stands to leave, leaning in to give MARLOWE a kiss on cheek. EVE (cont'd) (quietly) I do wish we could let the world know one day. It would cause such thrilling chaos.  13.
I think the world has more than enough chaos to contend with.

Perhaps you’re right, Doctor Faustus. She laughs as MARLOWE briefly glares at her. EVE then goe out the door, MARLOWE watching through the window as she pulls her scarf over her face and crosses the Petit Socco MARLOWE, clasping his own white plastic bag, then also ri to leave.

Oh, Adam. You've been deeply depressed before. Remember the 1820s? And your reaction to the first World War, that did scare the shit out of me, to say nothing of the Spanish Civil War. Then the 1950s...the ‘70s...  21.

(flatly) Sounds exciting.
(after a pause) What about your music? On EVE’s screen, ADAM sullenly surveys his instruments an equipment surrounding him.

Oh, Adam...Why don’t you just fucking come here and kiss me? In the past you so loved Tangier. (pause) You loved the music. And those times when your friends all lived here -- Burroughs and Brion Gysin. Paul Bowles, Brian Jones...

Seriously? There is a long pause. EVE (cont'd) Oh, fuck. (pause) Alright. I‘1l come. On EVE’s screen ADAM’s averted eyes return to the camera. On EVE’s screen ADAM can be seen shrugging and looking aw  22.

Well, that’s always a plus.

You really are too much, Adam. You know I still largely blame Keats and Shelley for your hopelessly romantic affliction. And a few of those French assholes too.

Yeah, well, in three thousand years momma’s seen weirder times than these. (then, half to herself) Although, not by much, I must say...It’s just the traveling that’s such a drag. (pause) Don’t worry baby. I’11 just pack the bags, ‘cause we’re going on a guilt trip. Seen on ADAM’s screen, EVE smiles and sends him a kiss.

Don’t come, Eve. Really. (pause) I love you more than...all the tea in China. EVE laughs and switches off her phone. From his velvet couch, ADAM watches the screen of his antiquated TV. It darkens, gradually fading to a white do at its center, the dot then eventually blinking off.
“You have said what you are. I am what I am. Your actions in my head, my head here in my hands  23. with something circling inside. I have no name for what circles so perfectly.” - Rumi
EVE and MARLOWE walk arm in arm, along the Place de Franc the Ville Nouvelle section, the architecture around them still faintly echoing a decayed form of 1930s glamour.
You sure you'll be ok? I can’t stand the thought of my not being an absolute necessity. I wish you could go with me, and help me drag Adam back over here.
Oh, god no. Traveling these last years, for me, is bordering on impossible. (then gesturing around him) And why would I want to go anywhere else?
They sit down on a low wall overlooking the port, a shutt and crumbling Deco hotel in the shadows behind them.
(looking out at the black glistening water) I had a dream about your sister last night. (he turns to her) Your infamous little sister...
You had a dream about Ava?
Do you even know where she is these days?

(returning) What? Oh. I’m sorry, I...I drifted away for a moment. (he gazes again at the water) To Italy, actually. A few hundred years ago...
Was he painfully good looking? He turns back to her.

You don’t need to worry about me, darling.
Alright, then. In any case, deliver my regards to that suicidally romantic scoundrel.

(his gaze again drifting away ) God, I wish I’d known Adam before writing Hamlet. He would have provided the most perfect case- study imaginable. Eve studies MARLOWE for a moment, as he stares off into t silvery darkness.

(she glances at the sky) It'll be fine, we’ve got time.

No, which concerns me a little. (pause) But we’ll find him, I’m sure. Come on. They make it to the next corner, EVE pausing to look up a the building where she lives. EVE (cont'd) (visibly surprised) That’s odd.

(in Arabic, wide-eyed but calm) What’s going on here? This is my apartment. The woman glances at the man, then stands up and immediat begins to gather their belongings, the girl instinctively springing up to help her. The man nods toward the two boy then stands.

(in Arabic) We are extremely sorry. We were told this apartment had been possibly permanently vacated. This is an embarrassing accident. Nevermind, but I still live here. She closes the door and leans against it, arms folding ac her chest. She surveys the disheveled state of her apartment. Furniture rearranged, ADAM unconscious on the bed. She crosses the room, making sure the curtains are tightl closed. CUT TO BLACK.

She pulls his hair away from one side of his face, then s him sharply across the cheek. A moment later ADAM stirs and grunts, then groggily raise one hand to his cheek.

(in a delayed reaction) Oww. (pause, eyes opening half way) What was that for? EVE smiles wanly, then leans in and kisses him on the che she had struck. No, not yet. But you gotta get up. We’re gonna go find him.

Are you sure? Then, after getting a better look at the strange couple a they pass through a shaft of dim light, he retreats. MAN IN STREET (contd) (in English) No, perhaps not. Fuck.

(enthusiasm somehow leaking through his depleted state) Eve, check this out. This chick is fantastic. EVE peers through the window. The singer slowly spins as sings.

(distantly) 82% of human blood is water. (pause, he turns to her) Have the water wars started yet? Or is it still about the oil?

(eyes returning to the dancing water) They only figure it out when it’s too late, don’t they?

Uh, well, 70% is covered in ocean (pause) then there are lakes, rivers... ADAM begins to gently pluck the strings of the lute, soon finding a haunting, minimal pattern of notes. (half delirious) What choice do we have, really?

How romantic of you. (then after another pause, eyes on the couple) Ok. I get the girl, though. EVE gently slaps him. She then braces herself and stands. She takes a deep breath.
